quoteFirst: [166] The distance is reckoned by the Japanese at three hundred and
quoteLast: hundred and thirty-three leagues; but these Japanese leagues are of unequal length, varying from eighteen thousand to about thirteen thousand feet, and the water-leagues generally shorter than those by land in the proportion of five to three.
